title: Authors and Citation
text: Sonnenberg H (2022). kwb.dygraph: Additional Functions Used dygraph-Objects. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/KWB-R/kwb.dygraph.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kwb.dygraph: Additional Functions to be Used with dygraph-Objects},   author = {Hauke Sonnenberg},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/KWB-R/kwb.dygraph}, }

title: Additional Functions to be Used with dygraph-Objects
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install kwb.dygraph in R install.packages('kwb.dygraph')  # Browse the kwb.dygraph manual pages help(package = 'kwb.dygraph')

what: add lines to dygrap plot representing begin and end of events — addEventLines
title: add lines to dygrap plot representing begin and end of events — addEventLines
text: add lines dygrap plot representing begin end events

title: add lines to dygrap plot representing begin and end of events — addEventLines
code: addEventLines(   dygraph,   events,   labels = seq_len(nrow(events)),   color = "red",   labelLoc = "top",   color.begin = color,   color.end = color,   labelLoc.begin = labelLoc,   labelLoc.end = labelLoc,   signalWidth = kwb.event::hsSigWidth(events) )

title: add lines to dygrap plot representing begin and end of events — addEventLines
text: dygraph dygraph object returned dygraph events data frame columns tBeg (begin time) tEnd (end time) events drawn labels labels given events (default: 1:nrow(events)) color color (default: "red") labelLoc "top" "bottom" (default: "top") color.begin default: argument "color" color.end default: argument "color" labelLoc.begin default: argument "labelLoc" labelLoc.end default: argument "labelLoc" signalWidth signal width seconds = length time interval one timestamp original data represents, e.g. 300 5-minutes-data.

title: add lines to dygrap plot representing begin and end of events — addEventLines

what: add shaded areas representing time intervals within
title: add shaded areas representing time intervals within
text: add shaded areas representing time intervals within "events"

title: add shaded areas representing time intervals within
code: addEventShades(   dygraph,   events,   color = "lightgrey",   signalWidth = kwb.event::hsSigWidth(events) )

title: add shaded areas representing time intervals within
text: dygraph dygraph object returned dygraph events data frame columns tBeg (begin time) tEnd (end time) events drawn color color (default: "lightgrey") signalWidth signal width seconds = length time interval one timestamp original data represents, e.g. 300 5-minutes-data

title: add shaded areas representing time intervals within
call dygraphs::dyEvent repeatedly — dyEvents
code: dyEvents(   dygraph,   dates,   labels = "",   labelLocs = c("top", "bottom"),   colors = "black",   strokePatterns = "dashed" )

title: call dygraphs::dyEvent repeatedly — dyEvents
text: dygraph Dygraph add event line dates vector Date/time event (must POSIXct object another object convertible POSIXct via .POSIXct) labels vector labels events. (default: "") labelLocs vector locations labels ("top" "bottom"). default: c("top", "bottom") colors vector colors event line. can form "#AABBCC" "rgb(255,100,200)" "yellow". Defaults black. strokePatterns vector predefined stroke pattern types ("dotted", "dashed", "dotdash")

title: kwb.dygraph 0.1.0 2022-06-11
